ud2.2:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud2.2:1.3: Now at that time, after the meal, on return from alms-round, several mendicants sat together in the assembly hall and this discussion came up among them:
ud2.2:1.4: “Which of these two kings has greater wealth, riches, treasury, dominion, vehicles, forces, might, and power: King Seniya Bimbisāra of Māgadha or King Pasenadi of Kosala?”
ud2.2:1.5: At that point the conversation among those mendicants was left unfinished.
